attributes.action: Guarantee the rights of Britons to "move freely and reside anywhere" in the EU
attributes.additional_details: Britons have enjoyed the rights of EU citizenship for 23 years, younger Britons from birth. We respectfully remind MPs that 48% of voters chose to remain in the EU with all the freedoms thus conferred. Many young Britons, to whom EU citizenship offered the most for the longest, were denied a vote and are angry at the outcome. It is clear, therefore, that a majority of UK citizens wish to see these rights maintained and that MPs have a duty to represent our wishes and protect our freedom.
attributes.background: We urge MPs to protect the rights granted to Britons under the Treaty of European Union, Article 8, "the freedom to move freely and reside anywhere within the [EU] member states" Our rights must not be rescinded nor our freedom lessened. Any treaty between the UK and EU must guarantee these rights.
